pullRequest.body:
prove basic result that such a space is topologically zero dimensional

leave todos for future directions

</details>

Thanks!

bors d+
Thanks a lot!

Thanks!

bors d+

**[lint-bib (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion title = {Equivalent characterizations of non-Archimedean uniform spaces}, ```
bot fix style

Should this stay here? Or move to some basic file on sets?
Also, should the name be `IsTransitiveRel`?

I followed the style in `UniformSpace/Defs.lean` which has the following explanation and defs
```
There is already a theory of relations in `Data/Rel.lean` where the main definition is
`def Rel (α β : Type*) := α → β → Prop`.
The relations used in the current file involve only one type, but this is not the reason why
we don't reuse `Data/Rel.lean`. We use `Set (α × α)`
instead of `Rel α α` because we really need sets to use the filter library, and elements
of filters on `α × α` have type `Set (α × α)`.
[...]
/-- The relation is invariant under swapping factors. -/
def SymmetricRel (V : Set (α × α)) : Prop :=
  Prod.swap ⁻¹' V = V
```
How about #22594?
Is that true ?? I don't have much experience with that kind of axioms so I believe you, but I would have expected that the statement would be "for some distance inducing the same uniformity"!
Could you add as an intermediate step that `IsTransitiveRel s` is equivalent to `s ○ s ⊆ s` ? And then deduce this as an iff?
Did you mean to resolve this? I don't see it in your code, but maybe I wasn't clear on what I meant.
Sorry, missed the `iff` portion of your request. I've added it now.
Could you provide a constructor taking any basis made of equivalence relations?

What kind of basis should we take? IsBasis, FilterBasis, IsTopologicalBasis, or something else? That this basis is used via UniformSpace.Core, or some other connection to the ambient uniform structure?
Or just a rephrase that uses HasBasis with the additional reflexivity condition on sets? Reflexivity is implied by symm+trans I think.

What I meant is, instead of considering the family of *all* entourages which are transitive and symmetric, assume that there is *some* basis for the uniformity filter (formulated using `HasBasis`) whose elements are transitive and symmetric.
Let me just write down the statement I had in mind that will be clearer.

Here it is:

```lean
lemma IsUltraUniformity.mk_of_hasBasis {ι : Type*} {p : ι → Prop} {s : ι → Set (X × X)}
    (h_basis : (𝓤 X).HasBasis p s) (h_symm : ∀ i, p i → IsSymmetricRel (s i))
    (h_trans : ∀ i, p i → IsTransitiveRel (s i)) :
    IsUltraUniformity X where
  has_basis := h_basis.to_hasBasis'
    (fun i hi ↦ ⟨s i, ⟨h_basis.mem_of_mem hi, h_symm i hi, h_trans i hi⟩, subset_rfl⟩)
    (fun _ hs ↦ hs.1)
```

The goal is simply that, if you happen to have your favorite basis for the uniformity (e.g nice subrings) which satisfy the conditions, it spares you from studying *all* the entourages satisfying the condition.

Could you break this down into:
- balls for transitive relations are open
- balls for equivalence relations are disjoint (or equal)
- balls for equivalence relations are clopen
- and then this result follows almost immediately using [nhds_basis_uniformity'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/UniformSpace/Defs.html#nhds_basis_uniformity') (more precisely this gives you *a* basis of clopen sets, and then [Filter.HasBasis.to_hasBasis'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Bases/Basic.html#Filter.HasBasis.to_hasBasis') finishes the job)

I did most of this in [323d893](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22580/commits/323d89349cc98d22945baaddf50acd78bb6eb606)

I didn't do the `Disjoint` lemma because really that should go through [disjoint_or_subset_of_isClopen](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Connected/Clopen.html#disjoint_or_subset_of_isClopen) iiuc.

No I didn't mean [disjoint_or_subset_of_isClopen](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Connected/Clopen.html#disjoint_or_subset_of_isClopen), because this has a connectedness hypothesis. But after playing a bit with the proof (see above suggestion) I realize that the disjointness lemma would essentially be unnecessary boilerplate.

```suggestion
    s ○ s ⊆ s :=
  fun ⟨_, _⟩ ⟨_, hxz, hzy⟩ ↦ h hxz hzy
```

```suggestion
  simp [IsTransitiveRel]
```

```suggestion
  simp [IsTransitiveRel]
```

```suggestion
  simp +contextual [IsTransitiveRel]
```

```suggestion
    IsTransitiveRel (symmetrizeRel s) :=
  fun _ _ _ hxy hyz ↦ ⟨h hxy.1 hyz.1, h hyz.2 hxy.2⟩
```

```suggestion
  rw [← isOpen_compl_iff, isOpen_iff_ball_subset]
  exact fun y hy ↦ ⟨V, h', fun z hyz hxz ↦ hy <| h_trans hxz <| h_symm.mk_mem_comm.mp hyz⟩
```

```suggestion
  hasBasis : (𝓤 X).HasBasis
```

```suggestion
    TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis {s : Set X | IsClopen s} :=
  .of_hasBasis_nhds fun x ↦ by simpa [and_comm] using nhds_basis_clopens x
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/UniformSpace): define nonarchimedean uniformity
